intro: Ageratina exserto-venosa, commonly known as the hairy ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, white to violet-blue flower heads. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its inflorescence consists of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, pale flowers that attract pollinators. Ageratina exserto-venosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
